$LOCALIZE[31130] Various skin settings. Configure what the power button in the home screen mini menu does. OPEN SHUTDOWN MENU is the default option for Kodi. This will open the shutdown menu when the power button in the homescreen mini menu is clicked. EXIT will close Kodi with one click. NOTE: The homescreen label will change according which option is set. Configure what pressing the back button on the home screen widgets will do. OPEN MAIN MENU will save the current focus postion and then open the main menu. RESET WIDGET will return the focus position back to the first item in the widget. Configure what pressing the left button on the home screen widgets will do. If the current focus positon is on the first item in the widget, OPEN MAIN MENU will open the main menu, WRAP TO END will set the focus position to the LAST item in the widget. Enabling this option will set the focus frame around items to use the color from the current color theme. This setting applies to all menu items such as posters and category widgets but it excludes list items. If this option is disabled it will use the color from the default color theme. Enabling this option will show the current time in the InfoLine located right above the widget items. This will show in the homescreen, search window, and all video windows. Enabling this option will show navigation arrows next to the InfoLine on the left side of the homescreen. Navigation arrows show widget position: Two down arrows: First widget (top of list) | Two up arrows: Last widget (bottom of list) | Up and down arrow: Middle widgets (more above and below) Enabling this option will show colored studio logos for media content in the FlixPanel. Enabling this option will allow for one-click access to Wall/WallScape view when pressing down in Flix/FlixScape view. This is useful for quick browsing larger lists. When scrolling is stopped in Wall/WallScape view, the skin will automatically switch back to Flix/FlixScape view. Enabling this option will auto end playback after a custom number of minutes [B]IF[/B] playback is paused. Enter custom delay for ending playback. Search settings. Set your desired search provider. This will use the selected addon for searches in the search window and default search dialog. This setting can be changed on the fly in the search window mini menu. Enabling this option will use the built-in search window. Disabling this option will use the default search dialog. The advantage to using the search window is that you can see results for multiple media types all at once (movies, tvshows, etc). Set the search window behavior. OPEN KEYBOARD will open a keybaord when the Search button is clicked in the homescreen mini menu. OPEN SEARCH WINDOW will open the search window where you can see your search history, view TRAKT lists, etc. Enabling or disable the showing of specific search widgets.
Ratings and trailer settings. 3vfnf74hymhc0tpzkizms3slp Click to enter your API key to activate ratings and an optional trailer source. If you do not have an API key, please go to https://mdblist.com to sign up for a free one. Click to change your API key. If you would like to completely clear it, enter an empty API key. Click to show all ratings. If you'd like to completely remove ratings, enter an empty API key above. Click to hide all ratings. If you'd like to completely remove ratings, enter an empty API key above. Enabling or disable the showing of specific ratings. Remove your API key. This will remove and disable all ratings in the skin. Toggle trailer viewing options. OFF: Disable all skin trailer functions. ONE-CLICK: Trailers are played by pressing a custom mapped button. AUTO: Trailers are automatically played after an item has been focused and the delay time has passed. Choose where to play trailers from. Default will use Kodi's built-in trailer method. MDbList will play trailers from the MDbList API. [B]NOTE:[/B] Default option does not require an API key whereas MDbList does. Click this to begin key mapping for one-click access to trailers. Follow the instructions provided in the notification window to map custom key. Set the amount of time to wait before playing the trailer. Enabling this option will show a small play icon at the beginning of the InfoLine. This icon works as a visual indication of when a trailer is loaded and ready to be played. $LOCALIZE[31129] $LOCALIZE[31169] Enabling this option will show clearlogos for media content. Disabling this option will use a default text title. Choose your preferred font style for text titles. Click to set a custom background image. Click to restore background image to default. Enabling this option will blur the background. Disabling this option will use either a black background, or the color theme depending on the artwork configured. (Landscape = color theme, Fanart = Solid black background) This option sets the intensity of the background blur. Higher values will wash out more detail. Lower values will keep more detail. RECOMMENDED VALUES: 2-40. DEFAULT VALUE: 30 This option sets the color intensity of the background blur. Higher values will create more saturated intense colors. Lower values will create less intense, more neutral colors. DEFAULT VALUE: 1.5 $LOCALIZE[31171] Cache and reset related options. Click to unlock all views that have previously been locked. You can always re-lock a view in the View options of any window. Click clear the blur cache. You can see the cache size in megabytes on the right. NOTE: The cache does not need to be cleared when changing the blur radius or saturation values in order for the changes to take effect. Remove your API key. This will remove and disable all ratings in the skin. Clear the ratings cache. This will remove all stored ratings in the database and fetch brand new ones when an item is focused. It is not recommended to use this often as retrieving new ratings is slower and involves more API calls. Click to clear the search history. The search history can also be cleared via the mini menu in the search window.
